file_content.text: How can a Dark Council member just disappear?
What do you mean he's disappeared?
Disappear?
He's just gone.
He's a very clever man, but I'm cleverer.
He won't get away.
Let's hope so. The attack on Thanaton's base was devastating, but things are too quiet.
We have to find him before he has a chance to strike.
I almost had him.
I've got every analyst in my command on it. I'm calling in favors with Imperial Intelligence.
As I suspected. You don't have the power to defend your own.
Half-measures count for nothing in the Kaggath.
Now, see if you can finish what you've started.
The show will be at the government plaza. Everyone will be there. Don't miss it.
...lord... heavy fire... help!
Front lines base... Republic forces... defenses weakened... reckless disregard... un-Imperial behavior.
What's going on? I can't hear you.
You're breaking up.
You're under attack? Hold tight, I'll be right there.
I'll help you.
...Republic surprise attack... need help.
This is one of Thanaton's traitorous plots, isn't it?
Thanaton will pay for this.
...not Thanaton... Republic surprise attack... need help.
Hurry...!
We've located Thanaton's main base of operations on Corellia--an old Republic Command center inside the Museum of Corellian Industry.
All of his resources are centered on that base. And better still--few people know that it no longer belongs to the Republic.
We must obliterate Thanaton's base. Get the fleet ready.
Then that's where we strike.
How does that help us?
Why do I care?
We kill two birds with one stone. To the Empire, it's a military victory. To the Sith, a victory in the Kaggath.
I've always wondered why Thanaton never invited me to his place. I guess I'll have to check it out on my own.
I'll pay him a visit.
The Kaggath frowns on half-measures. We must utterly destroy Thanaton's base.
The fleet has more than enough firepower to do the job, but unfortunately the base is shielded from within against orbital attacks.
If I know Thanaton, the place is just as heavily guarded inside. To take out those shields, you'll want a strike force at your back.
Are you offering your men to help me?
What can you provide?
I'm afraid I don't have a man to spare, and certainly none with the kind of training you'd need. You want field commandos.
I'm afraid I've misplaced my strike force.
I don't have one of those.
I've made it this far without one. I doubt a strike force will do me any good now.
I don't need help.
Handle it your way, my lord. But you prove nothing by going into Thanaton's base unprepared.
There's an Imperial commando outpost outside the Coronet City zoo. They should get you inside the base to destroy the shield generators.
When the shields are down, the fleet will strike.
My lord! The refinery is ours!
But the assault was costly. I don't know if we can take many more hits like that. We have a war to fight, if you remember.
The fleet is refueling as we speak.
It's time we struck at Thanaton directly.
Thanaton's end is near.
As soon as it's done refueling, I want it in position and ready to deploy.
Let's put this fleet to use.
With pleasure, my lord.
Do we know where Thanaton will strike next?
What's Thanaton's plan?
With all respect, my lord--now is not the time to wait for Thanaton. Now is the time to strike.
The fleet is scheduled to arrive at Corellia shortly, but we can't refuel without that refinery.
If he is allowed to destroy the refinery, you might as well surrender the Kaggath now.
I protect my resources, Pyron. You can depend on that.
I'll take care of it.
I have no intention of letting Thanaton have the upper hand.
He will fail.
If Thanaton is allowed to destroy the refinery, you might as well surrender the Kaggath now. A Sith who cannot protect his resources is quickly despised.
Get to the Selonian tunnels quickly.
I'll dispatch my men to the Selonian tunnels right away, but you'd better get moving if you expect to catch your foe.
If I take Lord Skar's alternate entrance, I can intercept Thanaton before he can do any real damage.
I'll take the secret route.
We need a two-pronged approach. Have your men take the tunnels and draw attention while I try to cut Thanaton off using the alternate route.
Cover the tunnels.
I need some soldiers for backup.
I need support.
I'll see what I can spare, but the Republic is doing enough damage to our forces without them getting caught up in this struggle.
Get into those tunnels and stop Thanaton from destroying that refinery!
You'd best move quickly if you want to intercept Thanaton before he brings that refinery down.
Thanaton plans to enter the fuel refinery through the Selonian tunnels and destroy it, but Skar taught me a secret way in.
I knew Thanaton was determined to stop you, but this....
Thanaton plans to enter the fuel refinery through the Selonian tunnels and destroy it.
My lord, Thanaton has wasted no time.
He's cut off transport from this sector and trapped you here.
If I can't move around Corellia freely, I can't win the Kaggath.
Thanaton won't hold me long.
Thanaton wants you powerless.
I intend to give as good as I get. Where is Thanaton now?
He'll pay.
He's out of your reach, and he designed it that way.
I don't understand. What is Thanaton's plan?
What's he up to?
I can only assume he intends to limit your resources, and keep you contained.
My fleet is on its way, but it's useless as long as we're trapped here.
I hear you've already spoken with Darth Charnus about the transport problem. But we need to understand what we're up against if we're going to counter it.
Darth Charnus can help you with the transport problem, but we need to understand what we're up against if we're going to counter it.
He can't expect me to stay trapped. He'll have a plan, and I want to be ready for it.
Thanaton's clever. A schemer.
I have my best analysts working on getting you all the intelligence we can, my lord.
Moff Pyron, I need a list of Thanaton's known allies and resources. Anything I can use to crush him.
I want information.
Right away, my lord.
Any suggestions?
My lord, Moff Pyron. Thanaton's removed the commander of the 115th at the Islands Outpost. He's sent Lord Skar to take over.
Hmm. Skar is Thanaton's apprentice.
He's sent his apprentice, Lord Skar, to command the 115th at the Islands Outpost. But his purpose is unclear.
Thanaton probably intends to secure a victory in the Kaggath by winning the battle at the Islands Outpost, but I'd be wary.
He's making this too easy. Putting his apprentice within killing distance.
It's our chance to strike.
He must feel the risks are worth the reward of glory in battle. Or, Skar is bait.
Do you think it could be a trap?
A sinister motive?
I'd count on it.
I will find Skar and I will crush him--with my bare hands if need be.
I will destroy his apprentice.
Thanaton's not an idiot. He will expect you to strike at his apprentice.
Still. Lord Skar will be aware of his master's long-term plans. That knowledge could be priceless.
Then I have no choice. Trap or not, I must strike at Skar.
It's a risk I'll take.
Thanaton expects me to try to kill Skar. But what if I win him to my side?
I must turn the tables.
It would certainly thwart Thanaton's plans. A sure victory in the Kaggath.
Then I'll be sure to have a little chat with Skar before I kill him.
He'll talk before he dies.
This may be our best chance at learning Thanaton's plan, and confounding it.
But I must ask that you not kill Skar until we can replace him. Without a commander, the outpost is sure to fall.
Whatever you do--find out as much as you can about Thanaton's schemes. Good intel is key to victory.
Master, Thanaton has unleashed his fiends on us.
Forget the Imperials. Thanaton is attacking your ship!
You got it, Andronikos. Let's get back to the hangar.
Agreed.
Boss, Thanaton's hitting us hard at the hangar. I'm firing with both blasters, but they just keep coming.
Go help your supporters, my lord. We'll find Thanaton for you.
Our hangar's under attack. But the Imperial base is too important to lose.
You're right, Talos. We must protect the Empire.
Agreed.
My lord, forget the Imperials. We can't let Thanaton harm the others.
You're right, Ashara, a Sith Lord must protect his followers.
Agreed.
You're right, Ashara, a Sith Lord must protect her followers.
Agreed.
My master, the Imperials do not matter. Thanaton matters. This is the Kaggath!
I think Andronikos and the others can fend for themselves.
I serve the Empire.
I follow you, my lord.
I am bound to follow.
Yes, my lord. Ready when you are.
Aye aye, Captain.
Then let us go and find our glory, Khem Val. Let's make sure Thanaton pays.
Agreed.
This will be a feast for the ages.
Only time to help one.
Moff Pyron will have to take care of things himself. The Kaggath and my supporters are more important.
My companions come first.
I think Khem Val and the others can fend for themselves.
I must help Moff Pyron.
We are above all of this, Xalek, but I'll wear a slave collar again before I let Thanaton kill my companions.
Thanaton won't succeed.
Hmm.
You can help your friends or you can serve the Empire. I think you know which choice to make.
You're right. I know exactly where my loyalties lie. Sorry, Moff Pyron.
Friends come first.
It looks like I've read you wrong. Consider my support withdrawn.
